TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent Ms Lidija PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant served in ORG ( ORG ) and in DATE retired from service . His military pension was assessed according to his rank and DATE of service and was paid from ORG . The payments terminated in DATE , following the dissolution of GPE .

On DATE the ORG passed a law on changes of the Act incorporating into NORP law the former federal law regulating the pension insurance for military personnel ( hereinafter the “ Military LAW ” - Zakona o preuzimanju saveznih zakona iz oblasti mirovniskog i invalidskog osiguranja vojnih osiguranika koji se u PERSON primjenjuje kao republički ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . This new law prescribed that the former ORG pensions were to be assessed to CARDINAL % of what they received in DATE .

Accordingly , on DATE , ORG , ORG fond mirovinskog i invlidskog osigurnaja radnika PERSON , Područna služba u GPE ) , assessed the applicant ’s pension , as from CARDINAL October CARDINAL , to PERCENT of the amount he had received in DATE . After the ensuing applicant 's appeal was dismissed , he instituted proceedings with ORG ( Upravni sud PERSON ) . The applicant claimed that the decisions to decrease his military pension were unlawful and impaired his property rights . He maintained that since the NORP authorities had incorporated into the NORP legal system the NORP federal law on the payment of the former federal military personnel ’s pensions GPE was obliged to pay his pension in full amounts .

ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim on DATE . It found that the lower bodies applied the provisions of the laws regulating pension rights of the former ORG officers correctly . They based their decision on the LAW of DATE which provided that the former ORG pensions were to be assessed to PERCENT of what they received in DATE . Furthermore , the applicant 's property rights were not impaired by the NORP authorities as ORG stopped paying the applicant 's pension . The NORP authorities accepted the payment of his pension according to the relevant provisions of the Acts regulating that matter .

According to the applicant , in his claim of CARDINAL DATE , he challenged both the constitutionality of the decisions of the administrative bodies and ORG which reduced his military pension , as well as the constitutionality of the DATE Act that served as a basis for the reduction of his pension .

According to the Government , on DATE , the applicant lodged a constitutional claim challenging only the constitutionality of DATE Act that served as basis for the reduction of his pension , while he failed to challenge the lower bodies’ decisions as such .

On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) terminated the proceedings concerning the applicant 's complaint . In its decision the court stated that it terminated the proceedings concerning the constitutionality of various laws enacted in DATE and DATE , regulating pension rights of the former ORG officers , as on DATE the ORG had adopted a new law concerning that matter - the Former ORG ( Zakon o ostvarivanju prava iz mirovnskog i invalidskog osiguranja pripadnika bivše ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
The relevant provisions of the DATE LAW on ORG ( hereinafter the “ DATE LAW ” - Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) read as follows :
“ Every person has a right to institute proceedings challenging the constitutionality of the laws ... ”
“ Each person whose rights have been violated by a decision based on the legislation declared unconstitutional or unlawful may ask the body that took the decision to vary it ... ”

“ The Constitutional Court shall terminate proceedings concerning the constitutionality of legislation that has been repealed or brought into line with the LAW and statute law while those proceedings are pending before ORG . ”

“ Every person , who considers that any of his constitutional rights have been violated by a decision of judicial or administrative body or any other body invested with public authority , may lodge a constitutional complaint with ORG . ”
“ By a decision accepting a constitutional complaint the Constitutional Court quashes the contested decision and remits a case for re - trial . ”
